result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:26 AM Defendant Darren T Brook in court.  Attorney Aneeq Ahmad in court for Darren T Brook. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense received an assessment that was forwarded to the State, but is not yet ready to resolve case. Defendant is involved in treatment, and has been for about 3 months. Defense does not oppose setting a trial. 

State does not have input rescheduling. 

Court sets jury trial and jury status date.
Jury status hearing scheduled for March 2, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 7, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on March 7, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on March 2, 2023 at 10:30 am.

Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. There are no victims on this case. 

Defense gives update that Defendant is in treatment and will be undergoing an assessment next week. Defense has discovery and a pre-trial offer. New date requested in early October. 
State takes no position on scheduling.

10:12 AM Defendant Darren T Brook in court.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court notes that Attorney Ahmad filed a letter on Friday requesting to adjourn and waiving time limits.
The Court will adjourn the matter and have the Clerk's office to reach out to attorney Ahmad's office to schedule a new date.\

Filed by Atty Aneeq Ahmad, requests to adjourn prelim due to jury trial he has in Milwaukee County. Sent to CC Costello for review. Court Granted motion to adjourn. Will reach out to attorney today (2/07)  No victim/Marsy's Law issue, time limits waived via this request. ADA has no objection. Okay to reschedule.

ADDRESS INFO for Darren T Brook

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is prohibited from accessing any child exploitation material and any other sexually explicit material through the Internet or by any other means.  Defendant prohibited from contacting a minor over the internet or using a website to gather information about a minor. Defendant is prohibited from intentionally deleting any history from any computer or device that accesses the Internet. Defendant prohibited from using any application where the content automatically deletes upon the recipient opening the content. Further, the Defendant is not allowed to use any device that is allowed to connect to the internet.    Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with any child under the age of 18.

03:43 PM Defendant Darren T Brook in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
The Defendant waives the 10 day time limit.
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for February 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
